title: Interdisciplinary Service Learning Design Based on Biochemistry and Biology

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A service-learning program where professional learners apply biochemistry and biology knowledge to real-life problem-solving, utilizing simplified smartphone-based resource sharing and collaboration tools due to limited technological environments.

learning_goals: Learners can design ELISA experimental protocols to solve real-world problems in collaboration with field partner organizations
Learners can accurately measure hormone concentrations (e.g., pregnane diol in animal feces) by analyzing scientific data from biological samples
Learners can produce a portfolio (text + visual materials) reporting experimental results that incorporate reciprocal feedback from service recipients

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
